bio.intro: Hi! I'm Neem and I'm a Fullstack Software Engineer. I will be graduating from the University at Buffalo with an MS in Computer Science in May 2027. I enjoy tinkering with systems to figure out how they work, and I love building things (software, wood, 3D printing, fabric, anything really...)
bio.teaching: Aside from tech and creative pursuits, I also very much enjoy helping people learn things! I've helped students design, build, and test everything from mini wind turbines to their own social media sites. I have worked as a Student Leader for the First Year Engineering Seminar sequence (EAS 199/202), a Tutor at UB's Tutoring and Academic Support Services, as well as an Undergraduate TA for CSE 370: Human Computer Interaction.
selected fun facts: - I think command line stuff is cool (evidently)
- Big fan of small critters. Millipedes are one of my favorite insects
- I like playing the guitar! But I don't like using alternate guitar tunings, so I made a thing to help me keep track of them (<button onClick="simulateCommand('about -proj')">see projects</button>)
- I am double jointed! I can bend my index finger all the way back to my wrist :)
- I think minesweeper is one of the best video games ever made (I don't play many games)

projects.title: This site!
projects.description: Retro terminal themed personal site. Look around! Email me with 'contact -m'

projects.title: TeamUP
projects.description: A gaming-focused social media web app created as a part of CSE 370: Human Computer Interaction. Learned a lot about usability and accessibility on the web.

projects.title: DevDash
projects.description: A career development app for the tech industry aimed at college students. Created as the course project for CSE 442: Software Engineering.

projects.title: Ludu
projects.description: My own online adaptation of the popular boardgame, as an exercise in learning Go but also because other versions don't quite preserve the experience of playing the game as well as I would like.
projects.technologies: Go, React, Phaser (JS game framework), PostgreSQL, Docker

projects.title: Unfold Studio
projects.description: Interactive storytelling platform developed by Dr. Chris Proctor. Primarily worked on improving user experience and design of the app.

projects.title: DevU
projects.description: Autograding platform for the CSE department at UB with a focus on extensibility
projects.technologies: TypeScript, React, Sass, Express.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Figma

projects.title: Capture the Flag
projects.description: A web-based MMO capture the flag game. Steal enemy flags, protect your own! See Repo
projects.technologies: Flask, Phaser (JS game framework), MongoDB, Docker

projects.title: Tuner
projects.description: A web-based guitar tuner built as an exercise in JavaScript and because I wanted a place to transpose and save alternate guitar tunings.

projects.title: TCP Chat
projects.description: A command-line text chat application, consisting of one chat server and multiple chat clients over TCP connections. Created as an assignment for CSE 489: Modern Networking Concepts
